class  ComputeEvent
 Internal class use to inform the Cluster View that it is time to compute the new data corresponding to the polygon of selection.

Detailed Description

View displaying spikes in the PCA feature space.

Through this view the user can act upon the clusters by selecting spikes. All modification request is sent to the KlustersDoc object and the view is automatically updated via KlustersView when the clusters have been changed.

Author:
Lynn Hazan

void ClusterView::updateClusters ( QValueList< int > &  modifiedClusters,
bool  active,
bool  isModifiedByDeletion 
) [inline, virtual, slot]

Update the clusters which have been modified by the suppression of spikes (used to create a new cluster or simply move to the cluster of noise or artefact).

This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw. The view is redraw only if isModifiedByDeletion is true.

Parameters:
modifiedClusters list of clusters from which spikes were taken from.
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
isModifiedByDeletion true if the clusters of modifiedClusters have been modified by the deletion of spikes (moved to cluster 0 or 1, cluster of artefact and cluster of noise respectively).

Reimplemented from ViewWidget.

void ClusterView::undoUpdateClusters ( QValueList< int > &  modifiedClusters,
bool  active 
) [inline, virtual, slot]

Update the clusters which have been modified by the suppression of spikes (used to create a new cluster or simply move to the cluster of noise or artefact).

This method is call only during an undo otherwise the updateClusters is call. There are 2 functions in order to reduce the number of clusters to draw whenever possible.

Parameters:
modifiedClusters list of clusters from which spikes were taken from.
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

Reimplemented from ViewWidget.

step the interval to use in second.

void ClusterView::setTimeStepInSecond ( int  step,
bool  active 
) [inline, slot]

Updates the time interval between time lines.

The update is made both in second and in recording unit using step given in second. This is an overloaded member function to be called when the user changes the settings.

Parameters:
step the interval to use in second.
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
